alert.note: Alert for Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 2:28AM CST until February 24 at 8:44PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Franklin TN, Lincoln and Moore. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 228 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winchester, Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Decherd, Estill Springs, Petersburg, Tims Ford Lake, Sewanee, Lois, Mulberry, Marble Hill, Hurdlow, Booneville, Smithland, Kelso, Mimosa, Lexie Crossroads, Harmony, Belleville and Molino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
